sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A sermo[n] made by Iohn Chrisostome patriarche of Constantinople, of pacience, of ye end of ye world, and of ye last iudgeme[n]t. Whereunto is added an other homelie made by John Brentius of the vertue of Christes resurrectio[n] tra[n]slated into Englishe by Thomas Sa[m]pson De patientia et de consumatione huius sæculi, de secundo adventu. English John Chrysostom, Saint, d. 407. Brenz, Johannes, 1499-1570. Homelye of the resurrection of Christe. aut Sampson, Thomas, 1517?-1589. Castellion, Sébastien, 1515-1563.
[80] p.
In S. Johns strete by Nicolas Hyll, for John Shefelde], [Imprinted at London : Anno. do. 1550.
A translation of "De patientia et de consumatione huius sæculi, de secundo adventu", which was translated from Greek to Latin by John Theophilus, i.e. Sébastien Castellion.--Folger Shakespeare Library Catalogue. Place of publication and printer's name from colophon. Signatures: A-E. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
A sermo[n] made by Iohn Chrisostome patriarche of Constantinople, of pacience, of ye end of ye world, and of ye last iudgeme[n]t. Whereunto is added an other homelie made by John Brentius of the vertue of Christes resurrectio[n] tra[n]slated into Englishe by Thomas Sa[m]pson De patientia et de consumatione huius sæculi, de secundo adventu. English John Chrysostom, Saint, d. 407. Brenz, Johannes, 1499-1570. Homelye of the resurrection of Christe. aut Sampson, Thomas, 1517?-1589. Castellion, Sébastien, 1515-1563.
[80] p.
In S. Johns strete by Nicolas Hyll, for John Shefelde], [Imprinted at London : Anno. do. 1550.
A translation of "De patientia et de consumatione huius sæculi, de secundo adventu", which was translated from Greek to Latin by John Theophilus, i.e. Sébastien Castellion.--Folger Shakespeare Library Catalogue. Place of publication and printer's name from colophon. Signatures: A-E. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
John Shefelde]
Nicolas Hyll
